item.title: Horizontal Pod Autoscaler in Kubernetes (Part 2) — Advanced Autoscaling using Prometheus Adapter
item.description: The Horizontal Pod Autoscaler (HPA) is a fundamental feature of Kubernetes. It enables automatic scale-up and scale-down of containerized applications based on CPU usage, memory usage, or custom metrics. Traditionally, when scaling software, we first think of vertical scaling: the CPU and the RAM are increased so the application consuming them can perform better. While this seems like a flawless mechanism on paper, it actually comes with many drawbacks. First, upgrading the CPU or RAM on a physical machine (or VM) requires downtime and unless a Pod Disruption Budget (PDB) is used to handle disruptions, all pods will be evicted and recreated in the new resized node.
